chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Repeater] and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) [Modifiers: Repeater]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Repeater] and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) [Modifiers: Repeater] was dismissed by the court.

  • David A Ophime was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • David A Ophime was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

IMPOSED & STAYED.
1/26/18 Crt amends JOC to give 137 days credit and making the def eligible for SAP and CIP.
IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $1519  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.
Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency.
OWI Treatment Court. Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With huber.  Provisions of 973.09(1)(d) (Good Time) apply.
